snippet: Five more people in southeast Georgia have been charged with helping an antigovernment militia accused of killing two people.
abstract: Five more people in southeast Georgia have been charged with helping an antigovernment militia accused of killing two people; charged are Christopher Jenderseck, Adam Dearman, Timothy Joiner, Anthony Garner and Randall Blake Dearman; three other people suspected of membership in FEAR, or Forever Enduring Always Ready, already face the death penalty for the December 2011 murders.

headline.main: Georgia: More Charges In Militia Plot
headline.print_headline: Georgia: More Charges In Militia Plot

snippet: Dorie Greenspan and Susan Berlin are each making the leap into opening a brick-and-mortar shop.
abstract: Dorie Greenspan, a food writer and author of several cookbooks, is opening two retail shops called Beurre & Sel in New York; Susan Berlin is another baker who is also making the leap into opening a brick-and-mortar shop, called Say it With Cake.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Say it With Cake (Manhattan, NY, Bakery)

snippet: Governor, a restaurant where fresh flavors take a twist, helps dispel notions that good food is not to be found in Dumbo, Brooklyn.
abstract: Pete Wells reviews Governor restaurant in Dumbo, Brooklyn.

snippet: GoDaddy, the Web services company, said that its technical problems on Monday were a result of internal issues, not an attack by a supporter of Anonymous, the loose confederation of rogue hackers.
abstract: GoDaddy, the Web services company, said that its technical problems on Monday were a result of internal issues, not an attack by a supporter of Anonymous, the loose confederation of rogue hackers.

headline.main: GoDaddy Says Its Troubles Were Not Hacker-Related
headline.print_headline: GoDaddy Says Its Disruption Was Not Caused by a Hacker

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and NICK BILTON

snippet: Stocks rose as investors awaited word on actions by the Federal Reserve and a German court.
abstract: Stocks rise and the Dow Jones industrial average reaches its highest level in more than four and a half years as investors continue to wait for decisions from the Federal Reserve and a German court.

headline.main: Dow Index at Highest Close Since ’07
headline.print_headline: Dow Index at Highest Close Since ’07

snippet: Several courts have lately been expanding the already broad protections that derivatives and repo contracts enjoy.
abstract: Several courts have lately been expanding the already broad protections that derivatives and repo contracts enjoy.

headline.main: Too Much Protection for Derivatives in Bankruptcy

snippet: T-Mobile USA is the one major carrier in the United States that has not had a deal with Apple to sell iPhones to its customers. But it is aiming to take advantage of the iPhone by introducing a marketing campaign aimed at people who want to bring ...
abstract: T-Mobile USA is the one major carrier in the United States that has not had a deal with Apple to sell iPhones to its customers. But it is aiming to take advantage of the iPhone by introducing a marketing campaign aimed at people who want to bring older versions of the iPhone to T-Mobile's network.

headline.main: T-Mobile USA Says Bring Us Your iPhones

snippet: A critique of grammar, style and usage in The Times. This week: a verb form in peril.
abstract: A critique of grammar, style and usage in The Times. This week: a verb form in peril.

snippet: As Apple prepares to unveil its latest iPhone this week, the company's manufacturing partner in China, Foxconn Technology, is coming under renewed criticism over labor practices. Foxconn is accused of compelling vocational students to work at plan...
abstract: As Apple prepares to unveil its latest iPhone this week, the company's manufacturing partner in China, Foxconn Technology, is coming under renewed criticism over labor practices. Foxconn is accused of compelling vocational students to work at plants making iPhones, report David Barboza and Charles Duhigg in Tuesday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Chinese Plant Faces New Labor Issue on iPhones

snippet: YouTube lost its prime real estate on the next version of the iPhone, where it has been on the home screen since 2007. In response, YouTube released a new app in the App Store.
abstract: YouTube lost its prime real estate on the next version of the iPhone, where it has been on the home screen since 2007. In response, YouTube released a new app in the App Store.

headline.main: Losing Its Place on the iPhone, YouTube Introduces a New iPhone App
